alert.note: Alert for Ferry (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 10 at 6:39AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: .Heavy rain may fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers may increase quickly and reach critical levels. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of North Idaho, including the following counties, Bonner and Boundary. Portions of Northeast Washington, including the following counties, Ferry, Pend Oreille and Stevens. * WHEN...From 1 PM PDT this afternoon through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage areas. Rockfalls will be possible on steep slopes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rainfall amounts between one and three inches combined with elevated snow melt will increase runoff and bring the potential for minor flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for additional flood advisories or warnings for nuisance flooding. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
